sense.name: Desire to have something done, with or without the authority to order it done.
sense.examples: I willed it to be done. King Henry willed it that those decorations should be splendid that year. We willed the sun to come out.

sense.name: Leave to someone after one's death.
sense.commentary: Syntax is: NP1[agent[human]] WILL NP2[patient[concrete]] PP{to NP[recipient]} NP1[agent[human]] WILL NP3[recipient] NP2[patient[concrete]]
sense.examples: Will daughters have equal rights if father willed the property to sons? Mrs. Crane willed her estate to the city. My grandfather willed all his art to me.
